3.heading: Har Mandir Sahib.
3.title: "Guru Arjan : the Man Who Knew No Fear"
3.author: script, Rajinder Singh Rag ; illustrations, Dilip Kadam ; editor, Anant Pai
3.appears_in: p. 1-29 in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 740 (1983, 2010 printing).
notes: Summary from back cover: "When Guru Ramdas chose his youngest son, Arjanmal, to succeed him as the fifth guru of the Sikhs, it created a lot of ill will in his eldest son, Prithichand. But the choice was not wrong. Guru Arjan was the very embodiment of love, humility and courage. His greatest contribution to Sikhism was the compilation of the Guru Granth Sahib and the construction of the Har Mandir Sahib in Amritsar. he was the first Sikh martyr and by his death inspired his followers to uphold the truth under any pressure."

15.heading: Hara-Kiri.
15.title: "The Computer"
15.author: Moebius
15.appears_in: p. 15 in French Ticklers, no. 3 (Feb. 1990) ; and 1 p. in Moebius 1/2 (Anaheim, CA : Graphitti Designs, 1991).
notes: Summary: A cutaway view of a mainframe computer lab, showing slaves turning wheels below the floor.

16.heading: Hara-Kiri.
16.title: "The Danger of Having a Speck in Your Eye"
16.author: by Moebius
notes: Summary: A nuclear power plant worker has developed atomic vision and has disintegrated 27 people so far. Originally in Hara-Kiri in 1963 or 1964 ; reprinted in Moebius 1/2 (Graphitti Designs, 1991).

17.heading: Hara-Kiri.
17.title: "The End"
17.author: Moebius
notes: Summary: A man alone in a deserted city falls down a chute to Hell. Originally in Hara-Kiri in 1963 or 1964 ; reprinted in Moebius 1/2 (Graphitti Designs, 1991).

18.heading: Hara-Kiri.
18.title: "Good News"
18.author: Moebius
18.appears_in: 2 p. in Moebius 1/2 (Anaheim, CA : Graphitti Designs, 1991).
notes: Summary: Tony reads in the newspaper that he and Margaret are quits; he murders her and the police find him by reading it in the newspaper.

19.heading: Hara-Kiri.
19.title: "Jeopardized!"
19.author: Moebius
notes: Summary: A cautionary fantasy about the evils of television game shows, in which nobody can remember when Columbus "sailed the ocean blue." Originally done in 1963 or 1964 for Hara-Kiri ; reprinted in Moebius 1/2 (Graphitti Designs, 1991).

20.heading: Hara-Kiri.
20.title: "The Nightmare"
20.author: Moebius
20.appears_in: p. 16 in French Ticklers, no. 3 (Feb. 1990) ; and 1 p. in Moebius 1/2 (Anaheim, CA : Graphitti Designs, 1991).
notes: Summary: A barber who uses a straight razor dreams about blood everywhere.

21.heading: Hara-Kiri.
21.title: "The Perpetual Agony"
21.author: absurd idea by Topor, sordid art by Moebius
21.appears_in: 2 p. in Moebius 1/2 (Anaheim, CA : Graphitti Designs, 1991).
notes: Summary: A murder victim follows his murderer until he gets revenge, and the new victim begins stalking someone else.

22.heading: Hara-Kiri.
22.title: "Season's Greetings"
22.author: Moebius
22.appears_in: 2 p. in Moebius 1/2 (Anaheim, CA : Graphitti Designs, 1991).
notes: Summary: A gang member pretends to help an old lady in order to rob her; she turns out to be a good fairy so he kills her and takes her jewelry.

23.heading: Hara-Kiri.
23.title: "There Were Some Scrumbles in the Big Crate"
23.author: Moebius
23.appears_in: p. 12-14 in French Ticklers, no. 3 (Feb. 1990) ; and 3 p. in Moebius 1/2 (Anaheim, CA : Graphitti Designs, 1991).
notes: Summary: A magician's package at the post office opens and out come giant monster birds, and the magician is rather put out with the post office's treatment of them.

24.heading: Hara-Kiri.
24.title: "2R/R2 + R1"
24.author: Moebius
notes: Summary: A scientist trying to cure the common cold drinks a faulty solution, becomes a giant bat-like creature, and drags his assistant Jane into the lab with him. Originally in Hara-Kiri in 1963 or 1964 ; reprinted in Moebius 1/2 (Graphitti Designs, 1991).

25.heading: Hara-Kiri.
25.title: "War is Hell"
25.author: Moebius
25.appears_in: 2 p. in Moebius 1/2 (Anaheim, CA : Graphitti Designs, 1991).
notes: Summary: A new army recruit goes through basic training with high hopes, but tilts trying to stop the ball from cancelling the extra-point bonus on his first day of combat.

26.heading: Hara-Kiri.
26.title: "We Should Be More Careful About the Neighbors"
26.author: Moebius
26.appears_in: 2 p. in Moebius 1/2 (Anaheim, CA : Graphitti Designs, 1991).
notes: Summary: A man hires the Angel Gabriel as a hit man, and the police find out about it.

27.heading: Hara-Kiri--Indexes.
27.title: "Bibliographie de Fred dans Hara-Kiri"
27.author: Numa Sadoul
27.appears_in: p. 22-26 in Schtroumpf : les Cahiers de la Bande Dessinée, no. 9 (1972).

28.heading: Hara-Kiri--Miscellanea.
28.title: "Un Demi-Siècle d'Interdictions de Bandes Dessinées"
28.author: Bernard Joubert
28.appears_in: p. 28-33 in 9e art : Les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 4 (Jan. 1999).
notes: (49-956 ou la Démoralisation de la Jeunesse : les 50 Ans de la Loi du 16 Juillet 1949)

Begins: "Il y a vingt ans, des éditeurs tels que Casterman, le Square, Dargaud ou les Humanoïdes Associés s'écriaient à Angoulême 'À bas la censure hypocrite!', réclamant la suppression de l'article 14. Comment cet article, toujours en vigeur, de la loi de 1949, a-t-il été appliqué à la bande dessinée?"

English summary (from page 142): "Half a Century of Banned Comics. Bernard Joubert is a specialist on censorship. He gives us an overview of half a century of application of the law of 49, recalling the most memorable bans. Barbarella and Hara-Kiri in the sixties, for example. More recently the Japanese mangas have been in the censors' line of fire."
